snippet: A man who had been arrested and then released detonated a remote-controlled bomb, killing at least eight people in a minibus, although the target may have been another vehicle, the Afghan police said.
abstract: Man who had been arrested on suspicion of insurgent activity and then released by Afghan authorities detonates a remote-controlled bomb along a road outside Kabul, killing at least eight people in a packed minibus; brazen attack may have been intended against a nearby vehicle carrying workers to their jobs at the Defense Ministry.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kabul and Khost Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A man who had been arrested and then released detonated a remote-controlled bomb, killing at least eight people in a minibus, although the target may have been another vehicle, the Afghan police said.

headline.seo: Bombed Afghanistan Minibus May Have Been Mistakenly Targeted
headline.main: Afghan Minibus May Have Been Mistaken Target
headline.print_headline: Afghan Minibus May Have Been Mistaken Target
